00018 /**
00019  * open a connection to the Grid UI server
00020  * 
00021  *      The Grid User Interface server is the entry point to the Grid
00022  *  for users and user applications. This is where jobs are launched from.
00023  * 
00024  *      GridGRAMM has been designed to be able to be installed in any
00025  *  host, independent of whether it is an UI or not. Thus, to be able to
00026  *  submit jobs to the Grid, the server hosting GridGRAMM must connect to
00027  *  a Grid UI host to do the work.
00028  * 
00029  *      This routine opens a connection to a Grid UI host using a predefined
00030  *  username (i.e. all jobs will be run under said username). To allow the
00031  *  caller to communicate with the remote end, it creates two pipes, one for
00032  *  input and one for output, and redirect error messages to a file.
00033  * 
00034  *      These pipes lead to a child process that actually manages the 
00035  *  communication. Using a child process has several advantages: it simplifies
00036  *  the communication process by offloading the comm. logic to a separate,
00037  *  convenience tool, and by being able to use SSH as the child, we can increase
00038  *  security taking advantage of its encryption capabilities.
00039  * 
00040  *      The panorama therefore will look like this:
00041  * 
00042  *      HTML front-end --> processor.php <--> SSH <--> remote host <--> Grid
00043  * 
00044  *      @param server   A username@remove.grid.ui.host pair to use a command
00045  *                      processor
00046  *      @param grid_path Path to working directory in the local machine
00047  *      @param process  A handle to the child process that manages communication
00048  *                      with the Grid access point
00049  *      @param descriptorspec
00050  *      @param pipes    An array of file descriptors to be used to communicate
00051  *                      withe the Grid UI through the child process.
00052  */
00053 function open_connection($server, $grid_path, $process, $descriptorspec, $pipes)
00054 {
00055         // The ssh connection is a 'child' process, in the User Interface 
00056         // opened wit 'proc_open'
00057         
00058         global $process, $descriptorspec, $pipes;
00059         $descriptorspec = array(
00060                 0 => array("pipe", "r"),  // stdin is a pipe that the child will read from
00061                 1 => array("pipe", "w"),  // stdout is a pipe that the child will write to
00062                 2 => array("file", "$grid_path/error-output.txt", "a") // stderr is a file to write to
00063         );
00064         
00065         // Open the child process with 'proc_open' function. SSH connection with
00066         //  -x parameter, we need to disable the X11 forwarding.
00067         // $process = proc_open("ssh -t -t $server", $descriptorspec, $pipes);
00068         // Is required to us twice the parameter -t, otherwise we get the error:
00069         // "Pseudo-terminal will not be allocated because stdin is not a terminal".
00070 
00071         $process = proc_open("ssh -x -t -t $server", $descriptorspec, $pipes);
00072         
00073         // $pipes now looks like this:
00074         //   0 => writeable handle connected to child stdin
00075         //   1 => readable handle connected to child stdout
00076         // Any error output will be appended to $grid_path/error-output.txt
00077 
00078 
00079         if (!is_resource($process)) 
00080         {
00081                 echo "connection error!!!<br ></body></html>\n";
00082                 exit;
00083         }
00084 
00085 }
00086 
00087 
00088 /**
00089  * Close the connection with the remote Grid access point (UI node)
00090  *
00091  *      What we are going to do is to close the communication pipes
00092  *  and kill the child processes that actually handles communication
00093  *  with the remote Grid UI host (ssh).
00094  * 
00095  *  @note CLOSE_CONNECTION IS USEFUL TO DEBUG!!!
00096  *
00097  *  @param $process
00098  *  @param $descriptorspec
00099  *  @param $pipes
00100  */
00101 function close_connection($process, $descriptorspec, $pipes)
00102 {
00103         
00104         // Required to close the 'child' process, otherwise 'proc_close' function hangs!!!
00105         fwrite($pipes[0], "exit\n");
00106 
00107         fclose($pipes[0]);
00108 
00109         // The output from the commands
00110         // Uncomment to debug the 'child' process!!!
00111         
00112         while (!feof($pipes[1]))
00113         {
00114                 echo fgets($pipes[1], 1024)."<br />";
00115         }
00116         
00117         fclose($pipes[1]);
00118 
00119         // It's important that you close any pipes before calling
00120         // proc_close in order to avoid a deadlock
00121         //$return_value = proc_close($process);
00122         
00123         echo "\ncommand returned $return_value\n";      
00124 }

00126 /**
00127  * Install the program and scripts needed to run it on a suitable place
00128  *
00129  *      This function installs the docking program GRAMM and the scripts
00130  * needed to run it on a suitable local directory.
00131  *
00132  *      Since we may potentially be called many times in a short period
00133  * we need a way to make sure their jobs don't clash with one another,
00134  * most specially, that they don't overwrite each others' workspace.
00135  *
00136  *      For this reason, we use a separate working directory for each
00137  * request. This function will install GRAMM on the specified working
00138  * directory.
00139  *
00140  *      @param grid_path        local directory devoted to Grid work
00141  *      @param random_value     a random value to generate a unique
00142  *                              name for the working directory.
00143  */
00144 function install_gramm($grid_path, $random_value)
00145 {       
00146         // We copy the results.php to the working directory
00147         if (!copy( "./results.php", "$grid_path/$random_value/index.php" ))     
00148         {
00149                 echo "Error, can't copy results.php to the working directory<br /></body></html>\n";
00150                 exit;   
00151         } 
00152         
00153         // We copy the functions.php to the working directory
00154         if (!copy( "./functions.php", "$grid_path/$random_value/functions.php" ))       
00155         {
00156                 echo "Error, can't copy functions.php to the working directory<br /></body></html>\n";
00157                 exit;   
00158         } 
00159         
00160         // We copy the variables.php to the working directory
00161         if (!copy( "./variables.php", "$grid_path/$random_value/variables.php" ))       
00162         {
00163                 echo "Error, can't copy variables.php to the working directory<br /></body></html>\n";
00164                 exit;   
00165         } 
00166         
00167         // We copy the egee logo
00168         if (!copy( "../interface/egee.jpg", "$grid_path/$random_value/egee.jpg" ))      
00169         {
00170                 echo "Error, can't copy  egee.jpg to the working directory<br /></body></html>\n";
00171                 exit;   
00172         } 
00173         // We move the gramm files to the working directory
00174         // XXX JR XXX -- this should suffice
00175         exec("cp -f gramm/* $grid_path/$random_value/gramm/");
00176         // otherwise use
00177         // - in variables.php
00178         // - $my_location="/data/www/EMBnet/cgi-src/Grid/GridGRAMM";
00179         // exec("cp -f $my_location/script/gramm/* $grid_path/$random_value/gramm/");
00180 }

00182 /**
00183  * Start the Grid services
00184  */
00185 function enter_grid($pipes, $grid_pass)
00186 {
00187         // Remote EGEE middleware interaction
00188         // We run the Globus and Middelware commands in the User Interface, but the output goes to the local machine 
00189         // in the mounted directory
00190         echo "OOOO $grid_pass ====";
00191         
00192         fwrite($pipes[0], "grid-proxy-init  -pwstdin\n");
00193         sleep(2);     
00194         fwrite($pipes[0], "$grid_pass\n");
00195         
00196 }

00198 /**
00199  * Create working directory
00200  */
00201 function create_working_directory($grid_path)
00202 {
00203         // Random value for the directory
00204         global $random_value;
00205         srand((double)microtime()*10000);
00206         $random_value = rand();
00207         
00208         // Working directory in the local machine
00209         if (!mkdir("$grid_path/$random_value", 0777))
00210         {
00211                 echo "Error, can't generate the working directory<br /></body></html>\n";
00212                 exit;   
00213         }
00214         // Mkdir don't work properly with the permissions
00215         chmod( "$grid_path/$random_value", 0777 );
00216         
00217         // Gramm directory in the local machine
00218         if (!mkdir ("$grid_path/$random_value/gramm", 0777))
00219         {
00220                 echo "Error, can't generate the gramm directory<br /></body></html>\n";
00221                 exit;   
00222         }
00223         // Mkdir don't work properly with the permissions
00224         chmod( "$grid_path/$random_value/gramm", 0777 );
00225 }

00230 function job_identifier()
00231 {
00232         // Each grid job has a unique identifier
00233         global $identifier;
00234         $identifier="";
00235         $lines=file("./gramm/identifier.txt");
00236         // We retrieve the identifier
00237         $identifier=$lines[1];
00238         $identifier=rtrim("$identifier");
00239         
00240 }

00242 /**
00243  * Check job status
00244  */
00245 function check_status()
00246 {
00247         // array with all the text lines
00248         if( file_exists("./gramm/status.txt") )
00249         {       
00250                 $lines=file("./gramm/status.txt");
00251                 //We retrieve the information
00252                 $value=$lines[6];
00253                 //Last character 
00254                 $value=rtrim("$value");
00255                 return $value;
00256         }
00257         
00258 }

00260 /**
00261  * Upload user data
00262  */
00263 function upload_user_data($grid_path, $random_value)
00264 {
00265 // Two files to upload: Receptor file and Ligand file, for the gramm program
00266         // This loop is dirty trick to get Receptor and Ligand files
00267         for ($i=0; $i<2; $i++) 
00268         {
00269    
00270                 if($i==0)
00271                 {
00272                         $file_str="Receptor"; 
00273                         $upfile="$grid_path/$random_value/gramm/receptor.pdb";
00274                 }else
00275                 {
00276                         $file_str="Ligand";
00277                         $upfile="$grid_path/$random_value/gramm/ligand.pdb";
00278                 }
00279 
00280                 
00281                 $userfile = $_FILES['upload']['tmp_name'][$i];
00282                 $userfile_name = $_FILES['upload']['name'][$i];
00283                 $userfile_size = $_FILES['upload']['size'][$i];
00284 
00285                 // We check if the files upload are correct  
00286                 if ($_FILES['upload']['tmp_name'][$i]=="none" || $_FILES['upload']['tmp_name'][$i]=="")
00287                 {
00288                         echo "<h1>Problem: no $file_str file uploaded</h1></body></html>";
00289                         exit;
00290                 }
00291   
00292                 if ($_FILES['upload']['size'][$i]==0)
00293                 {
00294                         echo "<h1>Problem: uploaded $file_str file is zero length</h1></body></html>";
00295                         exit;
00296                 }
00297 
00298                 // $upfile = "./$userfile_name";
00299                 
00300                 // move_uploaded_file this function checks to ensure that the file designated by filename is a valid upload file 
00301                 // (meaning that it was uploaded via PHP's HTTP POST upload mechanism). If the file is valid, it will be moved to the 
00302                 // filename given by destination.If filename is not a valid upload file, then no action will occur, and move_uploaded_file() 
00303                 // will return FALSE. 
00304                 if (!move_uploaded_file($userfile, $upfile)) 
00305                 {
00306                         echo "<h1>$userfile y $upfile Problem: Could not move file into directory</h1></body></html>"; 
00307                         exit;
00308                 }
00309 
00310 
00311         }
00312         
00313 }

00315 /**
00316  * Create configuration files needed to run GRAMM
00317  */
00318 function create_gr_files($grid_path, $random_value, $resolution)
00319 {
00320 // We generate rmol.gr, rpar.gr and wlist.gr, requiered to run gramm
00321 
00322 // Writing rmol.gr
00323 
00324 $rmol="$grid_path/$random_value/gramm/rmol.gr";
00325 $receptor = "receptor";
00326 $ligand = "ligand";
00327 
00328 $fp = fopen( "$rmol", "w" );
00329 
00330         fwrite( $fp, "# Filename  Fragment  ID      Filename  Fragment  ID     [paral/anti  max.ang]\n");
00331         fwrite( $fp, "# ----------------------------------------------------------------------------\n");
00332         fwrite( $fp, "\n");
00333         fwrite( $fp, "$receptor.pdb     *    receptor  $ligand.pdb       *     ligand\n");
00334 
00335 fclose( $fp );
00336 
00337 // Writing rpar.gr
00338 $rpar="$grid_path/$random_value/gramm/rpar.gr";
00339 
00340 $fp1 = fopen( "$rpar", "w" );
00341 
00342         if ($resolution=="low")
00343         {       
00344                 fwrite( $fp1, "Matching mode (generic/helix) ....................... mmode= generic\n" );
00345                 fwrite( $fp1, "Grid step ............................................. eta= 6.8\n" );
00346                 fwrite( $fp1, "Repulsion (attraction is always -1) .................... ro= 6.5.\n" );
00347                 fwrite( $fp1, "Attraction double range (fraction of single range) ..... fr= 0.\n" );
00348                 fwrite( $fp1, "Potential range type (atom_radius, grid_step) ....... crang= grid_step\n" );
00349                 fwrite( $fp1, "Projection (blackwhite, gray) ................ ....... ccti= gray\n" );
00350                 fwrite( $fp1, "Representation (all, hydrophobic) .................... crep= all\n" );
00351                 fwrite( $fp1, "Number of matches to output .......................... maxm= 1000\n" );
00352                 fwrite( $fp1, "Angle for rotations, deg (10,12,15,18,20,30, 0-no rot.)  ai= 20\n" );    
00353         }else
00354         {
00355                 fwrite( $fp1, "Matching mode (generic/helix) ....................... mmode= generic\n" );
00356                 fwrite( $fp1, "Grid step ............................................. eta= 1.7\n" );
00357                 fwrite( $fp1, "Repulsion (attraction is always -1) .................... ro= 30.\n" );
00358                 fwrite( $fp1, "Attraction double range (fraction of single range) ..... fr= 0.\n" );
00359                 fwrite( $fp1, "Potential range type (atom_radius, grid_step) ....... crang= atom_radius\n" );
00360                 fwrite( $fp1, "Projection (blackwhite, gray) ................ ....... ccti= gray\n" );
00361                 fwrite( $fp1, "Representation (all, hydrophobic) .................... crep= all\n" );
00362                 fwrite( $fp1, "Number of matches to output .......................... maxm= 1000\n" );
00363                 fwrite( $fp1, "Angle for rotations, deg (10,12,15,18,20,30, 0-no rot.)  ai= 10\n" );
00364          }
00365 
00366 fclose( $fp1 );
00367 
00368 // Writing wlist.gr
00369 $wlist="$grid_path/$random_value/gramm/wlist.gr";
00370 
00371 $fp2 = fopen( "$wlist", "w" );
00372 
00373         fwrite( $fp2, "# File_of_predictions   First_match   Last_match   separate/joint  +init_lig\n" );
00374         fwrite( $fp2, "# ----------------------------------------------------------------------------\n" );
00375         fwrite( $fp2, "$receptor-$ligand.res    1   10  separ   no\n" );        
00376 
00377 fclose( $fp2 );
00378 }

00380 /**
00381  * Create JDL description of the job to be submitted to the Grid
00382  */
00383 function create_jdl_file($grid_path, $random_value)
00384 {
00385 // JDL file to run the middleware command edg-job-submit
00386 $new_jdl="$grid_path/$random_value/gramm/file.jdl";
00387 
00388 $fp = fopen( "$new_jdl", "w" );
00389 
00390         fwrite( $fp, "Type = \"Job\";\n");
00391         fwrite( $fp, "JobType = \"normal\";\n");
00392         fwrite( $fp, "VirtualOrganisation= \"biomed\";\n");
00393         fwrite( $fp, "Executable = \"gramm.sh\";\n");
00394         fwrite( $fp, "StdOutput = \"gramm.out\";\n");
00395         fwrite( $fp, "StdError = \"gramm.err\";\n");
00396         fwrite( $fp, "InputSandbox = {\"$grid_path/$random_value/gramm/gramm.sh\",\"$grid_path/$random_value/gramm/gramm-go.tar.gz\"};\n");
00397         fwrite( $fp, "OutputSandbox = {\"gridgramm.out\",\"gridgramm.err\",\"gramm-come.tar.gz\"};\n");
00398 
00399 fclose( $fp );
00400 
00401 }

00403 /**
00404  * Extract results gathered from the Grid
00405  */
00406 function unpack_results()
00407 {
00408 // Take a shortcut
00409         exec("tar -zxf */gramm-come.tar.gz -C .");
00410         return $ret="OK";
00411 
00412 // We search the directory with the user results!!!
00413 // The results directory generated by the grid middleware starts with the grid 
00414 // user name
00415 $dir = dir(".");        
00416 $dir->rewind();
00417         while ($file = $dir->read())
00418         {       
00419                 // To change: $user
00420                 if ( substr($file, 0, 5)=="$server_user" )
00421                 // Or
00422                 // $contains=strpos($file, $server_user);
00423                 // if (($contains !== false) && ($contains==0))
00424                 // Or
00425                 // if ((is_dir($file) && (is_file("$file/gramm-come.tar.gz"))
00426                 {
00427                         // We extract the gramm results
00428                         exec("tar -zxvf $file/gramm-come.tar.gz -C .");
00429                         $aux="OK";
00430                         return $aux;
00431                 }
00432         }
00433 }

00435 function show_structure($message, $file)
00436 {
00437         $pdb2vrml1="/cgi-src/pdb_servlets/pdb2vrml1.php";
00438         $pdb2vrml2="/cgi-src/pdb_servlets/pdb2vrml2.php";
00439         $pdb2ps="/cgi-src/pdb_servlets/pdb2ps.php";
00440         $pdb2png="/cgi-src/pdb_servlets/pdb2png.php";
00441         $server="http://www.es.embnet.org/";
00442         $path=dirname($_SERVER['SCRIPT_NAME']);
00443 
00444         echo "<tr>";
00445         echo "<td>$message</td>"; 
00446         echo "<td><a href=./$file>". basename($file, '.pdb') ."</a></td>";
00447         echo "<td><a href=$pdb2vrml1?url=$server$path/$file>VRML1</a></td>";
00448         echo "<td><a href=$pdb2vrml2?url=$server$path/$file>VRML2</a></td>";
00449         echo "<td><a href=$pdb2ps?url=$server$path/$file>PS</a></td>";
00450         echo "<td><a href=$pdb2png?url=$server$path/$file>PNG</a></td>";
00451         echo "</tr>";   
00452 }

00454 /**
00455  * Show the results to the user
00456  */
00457 function show_results()
00458 {
00459         echo "<center><h1>GridGramm results:<br></h1><center>";
00460         echo "<hr>";
00461 
00462         echo "<center><table border=2>";
00463         
00464         $dir = dir(".");
00465         
00466         $file = 'receptor.pdb';
00467         if (file_exists($file))
00468                 show_structure('Structure of your receptor molecule', $file);
00469 
00470         $file = 'ligand.pdb';
00471         if (file_exists($file))
00472                 show_structure('Structure of your ligand molecule, $file);
00473 
00474         // walk through our working directory and look for R-L complexes.
00475         $dir->rewind();
00476         while ($file = $dir->read())
00477         {
00478                 // Regular expression to show the receptor-ligand files
00479                 if ( ereg("^receptor-ligand+_[0-9]+.pdb$", $file))
00480                         show_structure('Structure of receptor-ligand complex', $file);
00481         }
00482         $dir->close();
00483         
00484         $file = 'receptor-ligand.res');
00485         if ( file_exists($file) )
00486         {
00487                 echo "<tr>";
00488                 echo "<td>Listing of the 1000 best scoring docks</td>"; 
00489                 echo "<td colspan=\"4\"><a href=./$file>$file</a></td>";
00490                 echo "</tr>";   
00491         }
00492         
00493         $file = 'gramm.log';
00494         if ( file_exists($file) )
00495         {
00496                 echo "<tr>";
00497                 echo "<td>Log output produced by GRAMM</td>"; 
00498                 echo "<td colspan=\"4\"><a href=./$file>$file</a></td>";
00499                 echo "</tr>";   
00500         }
00501         
00502         $file = 'rpar.gr';
00503         if ( file_exists($file) )
00504         {
00505                 echo "<tr>";
00506                 echo "<td>Parameters used for the docking procedure</td>"; 
00507                 echo "<td colspan=\"4\"><a href=./$file>$file</a></td>";
00508                 echo "</tr>";   
00509         }
00510         
00511         $file = 'rmol.gr';
00512         if ( file_exists($file) )
00513         {
00514                 echo "<tr>";
00515                 echo "<td>Description of the molecules.</td>"; 
00516                 echo "<td colspan=\"4\"><a href=./$file>$file</a></td>";
00517                 echo "</tr>";   
00518         }
00519         
00520         $file = 'wlist.gr';
00521         if ( file_exists($file) )
00522         {
00523                 echo "<tr>";
00524                 echo "<td>Config file to set the results</td>"; 
00525                 echo "<td colspan=\"4\"><a href=./$file>$file</a></td>";
00526                 echo "</tr>";   
00527         }
00528         
00529         echo "</table></center>";       
00530         echo "<hr>";
00531 }
